name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Seattle Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time staying at a Homewood Suites. The outside looked very nice, however, the furnishings in the room looked a little tired and worn. I had requested and received a bay view room. The bay view was partially obstructed by the building across the street. The hotel staff were very pleasant and overall the property was in good condition. Not new, but not too terribly worn out. In general, a good room for a good value.
reviews.title: Overall a nice stay

reviews.text: I spent 2 nights at the Homewood Suites and it was better than expected. The best part was the courteous Front Desk personnel that assisted me when my wallet was stolen and I had to pay cash to check in - and they were happy to accomodate me. The room was large and comfy and very clean. A little off the beaten path but still convenient. $15 a day for parking is pricey but that is Seattle.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.text: We stayed at the Homewood suites after a work seminar in March, we moved over from the Waterfront Marriott, so we thought we may be slightly disappointed. However, the stay was great.
reviews.title: Great place for families

reviews.text: The daily breakfast and weeknight welcome reception was really nice. We have stayed at a few Residence Inn's and this was a little better. They actually do your dishes for you, this was a nice surprise as I am used to having to do that part. I still got it loaded every evening. We slept in every morning and the maids still made it back to clean the room. The living room area was roomy and the bedroom was acceptable.
reviews.title: Plagued with noisy children, rooms with paper-thin walls.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free Laundry, but of course that means there were only two washers and two dryers. It got a little busy on the weekend, but I checked it a few times after as it is in the same room as the gym, and they were available.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and good location

reviews.text: We, a party of 3, had an emicable stay. The hotel is well situated and indeed within walking distance (about 10 short blocks) to Pike's Place. The one-bedroom suites are relatively roomy. I can attest to the comfortability of the sofa sleeper. If your party includes more than a couple (that take up the one bedroom), I recommend that you ask for a suite with a bathroom whose door opens to the living area. Unfortunately, the staff apparently is not provided with a floor plan (how hard is it for the proprietor to do so, really?) and it is up to you to make sure that your room is laid out thus - try room *08. Unfortunately, these rooms face the freeway and you will hear traffic noise from the I5 nearby, although to us the noise was not excessive. Some cons: The Internet connection was flaky on the last day of our stay; the parking structure is not for the faint-hearted, requiring precise navigation of your vehicle and expensive ($25 daily) to boot; the taxes add another $25 to your quoted price; the water for shower is not hot enough after a while.
reviews.title: Good family hotel

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a sisters weekend getaway. The location worked out well...1 was a runner and it was close to running trails, 1 used the gym and thought it was good for a hotel gym. It was about a mile walk to downtown (Pike Place Market) and there was a city bus stop right across the street that went downtown. The free breakfast had a lot to offer...cold & hot cereals, muffins, fruit, yogurt and eggs, french toast, juices, etc. The dining area was spacious and looked out over Elliott Bay (view obstructed some by buildings). The hotel staff was very helpful and nice...no complaints. The only negative thing was our room was across from the elevator and there was quite a bit of noise from that...the walls seemed thin for this caliber hotel.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Very nice property, quick and friendly check-in. Nice spacious lobby and very nice comfortable breakfast room. The rooms themselves were spacious, with a living room, bathroom, kitchen and bedroom. A TV in the living room and bedroom. Rooms are modern and extremely clean. Free wifi is also offerred in the rooms. There is also a fitness center for guests. Breakfast was excellent and was included in the room rate. Eggs, french toast, cereal, juices, saussages, fruit, coffee, plus many others goodies. Plenty of food to start the day right. In the evening there is also food offerring, but not on the weekend when I was there. The hotel is a few minutes away from downtown, public transportation is across the street.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay

reviews.text: We recently spent 5 nights at this hotel and loved every minute of it. The staff is excellent and very helpful. The room was large and comfy, hot breakfast was very good and the dining area large with a big window for views outside.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — Only one computer in the business center.

reviews.text: The evening reception (mid week only) was good with nice wines and a local microbrew on tap. An ok entre was also served each night so if you wanted to save on dinner, that was also an option.
reviews.title: Spacious, clean and inexpensive

likes.liked: — The spacious suite and the free breakfast were fantastic

reviews.title: Nice location, nice amenities
reviews.text: A very comfortable 7 day stay here. The meals are a real plus... (we really enjoyed the breakfast selection and clean, classy setting). This hotel is a nice location from downtown and the Seattle Waterfront. Just remember that Seattle has some pretty steep hills if you're on foot. The front desk was very helpful with details, although we were disappointed that the 2 cribs that we needed were nowhere to be found upon arrival. My Son-In-Law even called the day before to confirm that they had been ordered. We traveled from the east coast with 3 little ones who were OH SO TIRED when we arrived. BUT a very special thank you to Angel who tracked down a crib and play pen for us when noone else seemed to be able to. Other than that? A really nice stay!

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. The desk staff were efficient and personable. They helped us with all of our requests regarding taxi service, nearby restaurants, and hours of certain attractions. There is a business office with computer and printer.
reviews.title: A Homey Accomodation"

likes.disliked: — A long walk from the heart of Downtown

reviews.text: The maid service was excellent.
reviews.title: So-So

likes.disliked: — Inexperienced staff, location in the middle of Hemp Fest.

reviews.text: The morning breakfast choices were excellent.
reviews.title: Good business stay

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious although not luxurious.
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel

reviews.text: A recent reviewer complained about this hotel, and I don't agree with any of their gripes. My family had 3 rooms here the night before our Alaskan cruise, and found it to be an excellent choice. The hotel is only 1 mile from the pier, and a short walk from the Space Needle.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle to the pier was already booked into the afternoon on our departure day, so we took taxis.
reviews.title: Don't waste your points or money here!

likes.liked: — Free breakfast spread had some decent options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rooms were all clean, spacious and comfortable. The beds, air conditioning and showers were great. The free breakfast was definitely a step up from the average mid-priced hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: We dealt with the front desk staff several times, and always found them to be courteous and professional.
reviews.title: Good Stay at this Property

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Beware the construction noise on the nearby streets
